intro: Bassovia sylvatica, commonly known as the red spruce, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, pyramidal shape and dark green foliage that turns a striking crimson hue in the fall. The tree produces small, cone-like structures that contain its seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in cool, moist environments, typically growing in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss and climate change, Bassovia sylvatica is considered a species of concern in many areas.
